messages.messageBody:
>> they don't match. Did you mean to quote "certificated" in the
example?>>

Dunno. I just did a copy and paste. Certificated was in there
somewhere when I first read it. LOL

>> English is full of dumb words.>>

I think we're all in agreeance there. (Anyone remember Fred Durst's
speech at the Grammy's?)

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] "certificated"
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/30/03 11:17:16 AM, zenmomma@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/30/03 11:17:16 AM, zenmomma@... writes:

<< Certificated


adj : officially documented; "a certified public accountant" [syn:

credentialed, documented] >>

they don't match. Did you mean to quote "certificated" in the example?


English is full of dumb words. My kids were joking yesterday about flammable
and inflammable. Marty was putting on spray on sunscreen and it said it was
flammable. We talked about maybe they should change the formula to make it
INflammable. <g> And that when you have a campfire you're probably no putting
on sunscreen, so it's not so bad.

Sandra

messages.subject: "certificated"
messages.msgSnippet: Just thought I d let y all know that this awkward sounding word *is* in the dictionary. ******************************************************** Certificated
messages.messageBody:
Just thought I'd let y'all know that this awkward sounding word *is*
in the dictionary.
********************************************************
Certificated

Certificate \Cer*tif"i*cate\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. Certificated; p.
pr. & vb. n. Certificating.] [See Certify.] 1. To verify or vouch for
by certificate.

2. To furnish with a certificate; as, to certificate the captain of a
vessel; a certificated teacher.

Source: Webster's Revised Unabridged Dictionary, © 1996, 1998 MICRA,
Inc.

Certificated

adj : officially documented; "a certified public accountant" [syn:
credentialed, documented]

Source: WordNet ® 1.6, © 1997 Princeton University
**********************************************************
Life is good.
~Mary
